newsitem.title: GERMANY: Krupp drops Thyssen takeover bid.
newsitem.headline: Krupp drops Thyssen takeover bid.

text.p: German steel group Krupp has withdrawn its plan to take over Thyssen AG, and the companies are exploring cooperation that would go beyond a merger of their steel activities, the two said Monday.

Krupp launched an $8 billion hostile takeover bid two weeks ago with backing from Germany's two largest banks, Deutsche Bank AG and Dresdner Bank AG, and U.S. investment house Goldman Sachs. It suspended the bid last week after Thyssen agreed to enter week-long negotiations on forming a joint steel company.
In a joint statement, Fried. Krupp AG Hoesch-Krupp said its takeover bid was void and would not be renewed.
